children.subject: <md>I haven't taken Data 140 but based on the list of topics I think you're going to miss out on some of the linear estimation/filtering stuff at the very end of 126. You can probably just read up on those portions</md>
at least going off this screenshot and the Prob 140 textbook, seems like mainly information theory, CTMCs, hypothesis testing, plus some of the estimation / filtering (as Anon Calc mentioned)

history.content:
Hi,

From what I have read from many anecdotes, and coming from having B+ in CS 70, I think EECS 126 will certainly very hard/near impossible for me to take and I should take for Prob/Data 140 instead for learning probability theory in depth.

However, am I missing anything important or useful in EECS 126 if I chose to take Prob 140 instead? If so, I'm planning to self study / practice on probability problems before taking 126 and not sure if that's a good idea since 126 is very intense conceptually overall.
history.subject: EECS 126 vs Prob/Data 140
